chess

Class ChessPiece

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.ChessPiece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, pawn, Queen, Rook

    public abstract class ChessPiece
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the abstract class which will be extended by each chess piece type class Each piece has a color (String), location(String), hasMoved (boolean), name(String), type (String) Those mentioned above will be set by the constructers initially when creating the table in the chess class. Additionally each subclass of this class will implement the following function: move, check.
    Author:
    Pedro Cruz

      abstract boolean check(ChessPiece[][] board)
      Will check if after successful move of current piece if it will put the opponent's piece in check
      java.lang.String getColor() 
      void getLocation()
      Will be used to print the location of the piece onto the board each time the board is updated
      void getName()
      Prints out the name of the piece
      java.lang.String getType()
      This method will return the type which is the piece, used for comparisons.
      abstract boolean move(ChessPiece[][] board, int toX, int toY)
      Will return true or false depending if the current piece is able to move or not, to the location set by the player.
      boolean movePiece(ChessPiece[][] board, java.lang.String to, java.lang.String possiblePromotion)
      Every piece will has the capability of moving as long as it passed legal moves.

      • getColor

        public java.lang.String getColor()
        Returns:
        the color of this piece

      • move

        public abstract boolean move(ChessPiece[][] board,
                             int toX,
                             int toY)
        Will return true or false depending if the current piece is able to move or not, to the location set by the player.
        Parameters:
        board - from chess class
        toX - row this piece will go to
        toY - column this piece will go to
        Returns:
        boolean

      • check

        Will check if after successful move of current piece if it will put the opponent's piece in check
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        boolean

      • movePiece

        public boolean movePiece(ChessPiece[][] board,
                         java.lang.String to,
                         java.lang.String possiblePromotion)
        Every piece will has the capability of moving as long as it passed legal moves. The generic moves are no out of board, and the specific rules of this (current) piece will be set by the the move method.
        Parameters:
        board - from the chess class
        to - String of coordinated indicating the next move.
        Returns:
        Boolean: True if successful or False and message print if failed
